Return an empty SSID if null.

title: Set Open authentication type flag to 0x0001 as per the WSC tech spec
message: Set Open authentication type flag to 0x0001 as per the WSC tech spec

title: Set preSharedKey to null for OPEN networks. Fixes #12.
message:
Set preSharedKey to null for OPEN networks. Fixes #12.

Checks for preSharedKey and SSID nullity were removed as they were
not really needed (network won't be added by Android if not valid
anyway).

title: Add AAR to NDEF message only if enough space on tag. Fixes #11.
message: Add AAR to NDEF message only if enough space on tag. Fixes #11.

title: Remove unused fields from Wi-Fi configuration record
message:
Remove unused fields from Wi-Fi configuration record

This does not comply with the specs anymore, but allows us to save
a few bytes on the tag to write even the longest SSID (32 bytes)
and key (64 bytes) possible (at least on an NTAG203 tag with 144
bytes user memory).

See #11 for more information.

title: Prevent BufferUnderflowException in NfcUtils#parse(NdefMessage). Fixes #1.
message:
Prevent BufferUnderflowException in NfcUtils#parse(NdefMessage). Fixes #1.

The previous code did not take the value of other fields into
account when looping through the payload.
This is a bug to report to the AOSP, from which the original code
comes from.

title: Try to be more precise when parsing WPA/WPA2 security from WifiConfiguration

title: Show a "Connect to Wi-Fi network?" dialog when scanning an application/vnd.wfa.wsc tag
message:
Show a "Connect to Wi-Fi network?" dialog when scanning an application/vnd.wfa.wsc tag

The dialog is taken from the AOSP source code. For now, the default Android
confirmation dialog is shown on devices running Android 5.0+ (except when in
WifiNetworkActivity), and our own dialog is shown on all other devices running
Android 4.4 and before.

title: Save user-entered passwords to database
message:
Save user-entered passwords to database

When no root access is given, the app asks the user to manually enter the password for protected networks.
Those passwords are saved to a local database so that he won't have to enter again after app closes.
